lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that when a child moves out of a troubled area, the results in later life may be even more positive than economists once believed.

headline.print_headline: Bad Neighborhoods Do More Harm Than We Thought
headline.main: Growing Up in a Bad Neighborhood Does More Harm Than We Thought

snippet: A new study suggests that when a child moves out of a troubled area, the results in later life may be even more positive than economists once believed.
abstract: The Upshot; Justin Wolfers Economic View column examines strong connection between neighborhoods of origin and economic success; cites research by economist Eric Chyn showing that those who grew up in bad neighborhoods will have lower personal incomes than those who grew up in better ones; findings support other studies and may reshape national housing policy.
